div.p: Apple's Environmental Technologies group is seeking a candidate to drive compliance to environmental regulations and drive sustainability initiatives on hardware products. The candidate will work closely with product design teams to define and implement environmental specifications including those on energy efficiency, design, and restricted substances.

ul.li: Experience managing, organizing, and maintaining deliverables of large projects
Experience interpreting and implementing environmental or environmental related requirements
Knowledge of environmental regulations on restricted substances and energy efficiency as well as environmental standards and certification programs is a plus
Individual who thrives in the details and able to manage multiple deliverables
Self-starter with a proven ability to influence others
Outstanding written and oral communication skills

div.p:
This position is offered in Apple's Environmental Technologies group within Apple's Hardware Engineering division. Our mission is to deliver the world's leading programs on the elimination of hazardous substances, improved material and energy efficiency, as well as design for environment. Apple believes that major improvements in environmental performance will be delivered through product design innovations.
The candidate will be responsible for driving Appleâ€™s environmental policies and initiatives as it relates to products. The candidate will drive cross-functional teams such as product design and system design teams to establish environmental targets on design and energy efficiency for new product designs. The candidate will need to have excellent time and project management skills to: execute test plans to validate environmental targets, attain certification for products to relevant environmental standards, provide regular updates to executive audiences, and review, interpret, and distill data. The ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams who are key stakeholders in the design of the product will be required.
Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Materials Science engineering preferred.
